alert.note: Alert for George (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 03 at 3:33PM CST until February 03 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN MOBILE...SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTH CENTRAL CLARKE AND GEORGE COUNTIES... At 332 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 17 miles southwest of Lucedale to 9 miles west of Gulfcrest to 6 miles northeast of Citronelle to 3 miles south of Leroy, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Citronelle, Lucedale, Gulfcrest, Calvert and McIntosh. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
